biogHist.abstract:
The Tailoresses' Association of Melbourne, Australia's first female trade union, was established at a meeting held in Trades Hall on 15 December 1882. At this meeting women met in response to attempts by the Melbourne clothing manufacturer Beith Shiess & Co to reduce piece-rate wages. A strike was called on 15 February 1883 when clothing manufacturers had not responded to the log of claims. As each manufacturer accepted the log, employees resumed work. The strike is generally regarded as instrumental in the establishment of the Shops Commission and the eventual passage of the Factory Act. When the new Factory Act was passed in 1885, the recommendations of the March 1884 Royal Commission regarding outwork were not incorporated and working conditions in the industry were not substantially affected by its operation. In 1906, the Tailoresses' Union amalgamated with the Tailors' Society.
On 15 December 1982 the Honourable Pauline Toner, Victoria's first woman Cabinet Minister, unveiled a plaque to commemorate the centenary of the Tailoresses' Union. The plaque was placed at the entrance to the offices of the Textile Clothing & Footwear Union of Australia (formerly Clothing & Allied Trades Union of Australia) in Leicester Street, Carlton.

descriptiveNote.p: The Honourable Pauline Toner unvieled a plaque to commemorate the centenary of the Tailoresses' Union at the officers of the Clothing and Allied Trades Union of Australia in Leicester Street, Carlton.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: CLOTHING AND ALLIED TRADES UNION OF AUSTRALIA, VICTORIAN BRANCH

archref.unittitle: CLOTHING AND ALLIED TRADES UNION OF AUSTRALIA, VICTORIAN BRANCH
archref.abstract: Tailors Society minutes 1890-1903; Federated Clothing and Allied Trades Union minutes 1908-1961; Federal Council financial accounts and general Secretary's reports 1933-1955; other state branch correspondence and reports; accounts and finance e.g. balance sheets, statements, cash books; membership material; awards and determinations; agreements with contractors; complaints; affiliations inc. ACTU, ALP, VTHC, Victorian Prov. Trade and Labor Councils; subject files e.g. broadcasts, disputes, women, equal pay, war; newspaper clippings; publications; photographs. Quantity: 111 archives boxes, 8 document boxes, 3 over-sized photographs

resourceRelation.relationEntry: CLOTHING AND ALLIED TRADES UNION OF AUSTRALIA, VICTORIAN BRANCH

archref.unittitle: CLOTHING AND ALLIED TRADES UNION OF AUSTRALIA, VICTORIAN BRANCH
archref.abstract: Minutes of meetings, organiser's files 1912-1913, arbitration and awards 1912-1961, membership material 1952-1956, unemployed members 1914 textile demarcation material, elections 1954-1961, outwork campaigns 1958-1968, international peace and nuclear disarmament 1961-1973, ACTU material, subject files, publications, newspaper clippings.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Clothing and Allied Trades Union of Australia

archref.repository: The Noel Butlin Archives Centre, ANU Archives Program
archref.unittitle: Clothing and Allied Trades Union of Australia
archref.abstract: Federal Office, Branches & predecessors. All types of union records for the Federal Office, Tasmanian and Victorian Branches and its predecessor unions of tailors, tailoresses' society, pressers union, the Vic. Clothing Operatives Union and the Tailors Trade Protection Society. Records include minutes, office files, correspondence, industrial files, financial and membership records, printed material, photographs.
